thoughtText: To truley understand pain.. one must only experience Texas in the summer
It's right around here that I entered into a zen like trance while typing, knowing this is probably some of the last work i will do in this class
It's been a pleasure working with all of y'all, thanks for all the help and I wish everyone nothing but the best
How far has humanity really progressed over the last 40 years?

Some of the best programming is done on paper, really. Putting it into the computer is just a minor detail. That's to say the deatil is the minor part about actually making sure your code works. Otherwise its just a hot stinky mess that makes you want to throw your laptop
When you don't create things, you become defined by your tastes rather than ability. Your tastes only narrow & exclude people. So create.
I'm not a great programmer; I'm just really good at not going insane, the trick... i've been insane for years :)
Sometimes I wonder if they really should of built a city in this swamp, devilishy hot in the the summer, humid all year long, its like they put people here to test thier capacity for punishment
The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
Delivering good software today is often better than perfect software tomorrow, so finish things and ship.
If you optimize everything, you will always be unhappy.
It's not a bug; it's an undocumented feature.
